kdl.prox.nsi2.apps
Class Centrality

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.nsi2.apps.Centrality

public class Centrality
extends java.lang.Object

The Centrality class consists of various methods to compute centrality measures, like betweenness and closeness, on nodes or links. These methods either require pathfinding or distance estimation, so they heavily exploit Search methods and NSIs.

betweenCentralRankingExact

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> betweenCentralRankingExact()
Compute exact betweenness centrality for all nodes; uses Ulrik Brande's fast computation of betweenness

Returns:
A list of nodes ordered by their betweenness centrality

betweenCentralRanking

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> betweenCentralRanking(int numPairs,
                                                                      Search search)
Approximation of betweenness centrality for every node

Parameters:
numPairs - Number of searches used to estimate betweenness
search - Search method used to find paths for each pair of nodes (e.g. breadth-first of best-first)
Returns:
A list of nodes ordered by their betweenness centrality

betweenCentralRanking

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> betweenCentralRanking(java.util.List<int[]> pairs,
                                                                      Search search)
Approximation of betweenness centrality for every node

Parameters:
pairs - List of pairs of nodes to find paths
search - Search method used to find paths for each pair of nodes (e.g. breadth-first of best-first)
Returns:
A list of nodes ordered by their betweenness centrality

betweenCentralLinkRanking

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer[]> betweenCentralLinkRanking(int numPairs,
                                                                            Search search)
Approximation of betweenness centrality for every edge in the network

Parameters:
numPairs - Number of searches used to estimate link betweenness
search - Search method used to find paths between pairs of nodes. NB: Must use a search method that returns a path (e.g. best-first). Cannot use breadth-first search.
Returns:
A list of pairs of nodes, corresponding to links, ordered by their betweenness centrality

betweenCentralLinkRanking

public static java.lang.Object[] betweenCentralLinkRanking(int numPairs,
                                                           Search search,
                                                           java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> objectIds)
Approximation of link betweenness centrality used to find the link with the highest centrality over a subset of the nodes in the network. Useful for clustering based on betweenness components.

Parameters:
numPairs - Number of searches used to estimate link betweenness
search - Search method used to find paths between pairs of nodes. NB: Must use a search method that returns a path (e.g. best-first). Cannot use breadth-first search.
objectIds - List of ids corresponding to nodes that can be used to estimate betweenness. Can be either all nodes or a subset. This will constrict the source and destination for the searches used.
Returns:
An Object[] consisting of o1_id, o2_id, and the estimated link betweenness for the link with the highest estimated betweenness

closeCentralRanking

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> closeCentralRanking(NST eligibleNodes,
                                                                    int numPathsPerNode,
                                                                    NSI nsi)
Approximation of closeness centrality for every node using an NSI.

Parameters:
eligibleNodes - NST of nodes to restrict closeness estimation. The returned nodes will be those identfied in eligibleNodees.
numPathsPerNode - Number of random nodes to select for each node
nsi - NSI used to estimate distance, instead of searching, between pairs of nodes
Returns:
A list of nodes ordered by their closeness centrality

closeCentralRanking

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> closeCentralRanking(NST eligibleNodes,
                                                                    int numPathsPerNode,
                                                                    Search search)
Approximation of closeness centrality for every node using a search routine.

Parameters:
eligibleNodes - NST of nodes to restrict closeness estimation. The returned nodes will be those identfied in eligibleNodees.
numPathsPerNode - Number of random nodes to select for each node
search - Search method used to find distances between pairs of nodes. Search method does not need to return a path, only a path length.
Returns:
A list of nodes ordered by their closeness centrality

closeCentralRanking

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> closeCentralRanking(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> eligibleNodes,
                                                                    int numPathsPerNode,
                                                                    NSI nsi)
Approximation of closeness centrality for every node using an NSI.

Parameters:
eligibleNodes - List of nodes to restrict closeness estimation. The returned nodes will be those identfied in eligibleNodees.
numPathsPerNode - Number of random nodes to select for each node
nsi - NSI used to estimate distance, instead of searching, between pairs of nodes
Returns:
A list of nodes ordered by their closeness centrality

closeCentralRanking

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> closeCentralRanking(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> eligibleNodes,
                                                                    int numPathsPerNode,
                                                                    Search search)
Approximation of closeness centrality for every node using a search routine.

Parameters:
eligibleNodes - List of nodes to restrict closeness estimation. The returned nodes will be those identfied in eligibleNodees.
numPathsPerNode - Number of random nodes to select for each node
search - Search method used to find distances between pairs of nodes. Search method does not need to return a path, only a path length.
Returns:
A list of nodes ordered by their closeness centrality
